meanings.definition: A small Jewish town or village in Eastern Europe.
meanings.sent1: Many generations of my family lived in shtetels.
meanings.sent2: The shtetels were known for their close-knit communities.
meanings.sent3: The shtetels had a charm that drew visitors from afar.
meanings.sent4: In my mind, shtetels are like tiny jewels scattered across the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The image of shtetels nestled among the hills stayed with me.

meanings.sent1: We visited several shtetels during our trip.
meanings.sent2: The map highlighted the locations of the shtetels.
meanings.sent3: The guidebook listed the shtetels as must-see destinations.
meanings.sent4: The shtetels on the horizon looked like miniature toy villages.
meanings.sent5: The folklore of these shtetels captured my imagination.
